SENT.plain: En bloc resection of the temporal bone is an extensive and complicated surgical procedure for removal of malignancies of the ear and temporal bone
The lengthy surgical procedure (18 to 36 hours) and the resultant functional disabilities and cosmetic deformities create special nursing management concerns
Preoperative preparation, carotid artery occlusion, and postoperative nursing management are discussed
Communication and psychological issues for the patient and family are presented
